byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and GIRISH GUPTA

abstract: Pres Nicolas Maduro of Venezuela, attempting to maintain power as citizens reel from currency devaluation and a crumbling economy, has intensified crackdown on his political opponents; attacks have been targeted against critics of so-called Bolivarian Revolution, and are exemplified by arrest of Caracas mayor Antonio Ledezma, who has been charged with conspiracy and plotting an American-backed coup.
lead_paragraph: Faced with tumbling approval ratings as Venezuelans reel from a steep currency devaluation and a crumbling economy, President Nicolás Maduro is intensifying his attacks against opponents.

headline.main: Amid a Slump, a Crackdown for Venezuela
headline.print_headline: Amid a Slump, A Crackdown for Venezuela

snippet: Faced with tumbling approval ratings as Venezuelans reel from a steep currency devaluation and a crumbling economy, President Nicolás Maduro is intensifying his attacks against opponents.
